name: update servSide state

set global uibuilder
cache by topic
Caching using simple function by msg.topic
info:
See https://github.com/TotallyInformation/node-red-contrib-uibuilder/wiki/Cache-and-Replay-Messages-without-using-node-red-contrib-infocache
for details.

The uibuilder control messages are used to 
replay or empty the cache.

Feed in your own data to the cache to see how it
works.

The way it is currently written, the last message
of each topic passing through the function node
is retained and then replayed as separate messages
when a new client GETs the uibuilder URL (or when
and existing client reloads the page).

## Configuration

Replace default `index.html` and `index.js` files
with those in the 2 comment nodes.

Change the name of the cache variable if copying this function.

name: index.html
info:
UIbuilder Cache Test Example

This is a uibuilder test using a simple function as a cache. Trigger the input a couple of times then load a new window or tab. The value below should almost instantly go from '[Nothing]' to that last sent value. However, the number of received messages should drop back down to 2.

Data from Node-RED

Random Number: {{nrRandom}}

Messages: Received={{msgsReceived}}

name: index.js
CACHE CONTROL
info:
from https://flows.nodered.org/flow/b9c7976357c0b67d04c66fa1e1a9ec0a/in/V8yzonL4DaUi
uibuilder pre-implementa un sistema per il reinvio on-demand di contenuti.
banalmente aggiunge una attributo "cacheControl" con valore "CLEAR"|"REPLAY"|undefined.
ricevere REPLAY significa che il client vuole ricevere una copia di questa cache 
        CLEAR che la cache deve essere eliminata.

non  finora servito, n prevedo che possa servire.

accessing msg withing script tag example (exploit)
format:
<script>
   //example 
   //from https://flows.nodered.org/flow/2f1aaf0635f9bf23207152682323240a
   (function(scope) {
      let i=0;
      console.log('Position 1',ObjectClone(scope ?? {notDef:true}));
      console.dir(scope);
      scope.$watch('msg.payload', function(watchedValue, unkn, b_akaAngularObjectRef_akaScope) {
         console.log('Position 2 #'+(i++),scope, arguments, ObjectClone(watchedValue ?? {notDef:true}));
         console.dir(watchedValue);
         //#1 outputs "...", scope === angularObjectRef, [undef, undef, scope], {notDef:true}
         //#2 outputs "...", scope === angularObjectRef,  [ msg.payload, undef, scope ], msg.payload
      });
   })(scope);

    function safeStringify(obj, indent){
      var cache = [];
      var cacheKeys = [];
      return JSON.stringify(obj, (key, value) => {
         if (typeof value === 'object' && value !== null) { //arrays and null are also "objects" //functions are too, but typeof returns "function" instead
            //Duplicate reference found -> discard key / store
            const idx = cache.indexOf(value)
            //if duplicate found
               //return twin's key instead
            if(idx != -1) //-1 means not present
               return "dupOf_"+(cacheKeys[idx].toString() ?? "root");
               //else store it
            else{
               cache.push(value);
               cacheKeys.push(key);
            }
         }
         return value;
      },indent);
   }
   
   function ObjectClone(obj){
      return JSON.parse(safeStringify(obj));
   }
</script>

name: shareNoderedGlobals utils
format:
<script>
   /* example 
   //from https://flows.nodered.org/flow/2f1aaf0635f9bf23207152682323240a
   (function(scope) {
      let i=0;
      console.log('Position 1',clone(scope ?? {notDef:true}));
      console.dir(scope);
      scope.$watch('msg.payload', function(watchedValue, unkn, b_akaAngularObjectRef_akaScope) {
         console.log('Position 2 #'+(i++),scope, arguments, clone(watchedValue ?? {notDef:true}));
         console.dir(watchedValue);
         //#1 outputs "...", scope === angularObjectRef, [undef, undef, scope], {notDef:true}
         //#2 outputs "...", scope === angularObjectRef,  [ msg.payload, undef, scope ], msg.payload
      });
   })(scope);
   */
   console.log("context here",this)

   (function(scope) {
      let clearWatcher = scope.$watch('msg', function(msg, unk, scope) {
         //run once with not-empty msg, then clear()
         if(!msg)
            return;
         
         let globals = msg.payload || {notDef:true};
         if(!window.shareNoderedGlobals){ //redundant, just to be sure
            //define globals in window
            for(let key in globals)
               if(!window[key])
                  window[key] = globals[key];
               else
                  alert("error: window["+key+"] is already defined") && console.error("window["+key+"] is already defined, with val",window[key])
         }
         else
            console.log("nodered globals already defined")

         //dbg
         let keys = Object.keys(globals)
         console.log("defined "+keys+" from vals ",keys.map(k => globals[k])," with vals", keys.map( k => window[k] ), " using arguments ",clone(arguments))

         //clear watcher
         window.shareNoderedGlobals = true;
         window["setThisOne"] = true;
         clearWatcher();
      });
   });
   
   function safeStringify(obj, indent){
      var cache = [];
      var cacheKeys = [];
      return JSON.stringify(obj, (key, value) => {
         if (typeof value === 'object' && value !== null) { //arrays and null are also "objects" //functions are too, but typeof returns "function" instead
            //Duplicate reference found -> discard key / store
            const idx = cache.indexOf(value)
            //if duplicate found
               //return twin's key instead
            if(idx != -1) //-1 means not present
               return "dupOf_"+(cacheKeys[idx].toString() ?? "root");
               //else store it
            else{
               cache.push(value);
               cacheKeys.push(key);
            }
         }
         return value;
      },indent);
   }

   function clone(obj){
      return JSON.parse(safeStringify(obj));
   }
   /**/
</script>

config page style
format:
<style>
   .machine-config.config-label {
      position:relative;
      top:20px;
      padding-left:5px;
      font-weight:bold;
      
   }

   body {
      --kitten:miao;
   }
   
   /*----- checkbox as animated switch -------
   //@supports (-webkit-appearance: none) or (-moz-appearance: none) { */
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify {
         --active: #275EFE;
         --active-inner: #fff;
         --focus: 2px rgba(39, 94, 254, .3);
         --border: #BBC1E1;
         --border-hover: #275EFE;
         --background: #fff;
         --disabled: #F6F8FF;
         --disabled-inner: #E1E6F9;
         -webkit-appearance: none;
         -moz-appearance: none;
         height: 1.5em;//21px;
         outline: none;
         display: inline-block;
         vertical-align: top;
         position: relative;
         margin: 0;
         cursor: pointer;
         border: 1px solid var(--bc, var(--border));
         background: var(--b, var(--background));
         -webkit-transition: background .3s, border-color .3s, box-shadow .2s;
         transition: background .3s, border-color .3s, box-shadow .2s;
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify:after {
         content: '';
         display: block;
         left: 0;
         top: 0;
         position: absolute;
         -webkit-transition: opacity var(--d-o, 0.2s), -webkit-transform var(--d-t, 0.3s) var(--d-t-e, ease);
         transition: opacity var(--d-o, 0.2s), -webkit-transform var(--d-t, 0.3s) var(--d-t-e, ease);
         transition: transform var(--d-t, 0.3s) var(--d-t-e, ease), opacity var(--d-o, 0.2s);
         transition: transform var(--d-t, 0.3s) var(--d-t-e, ease), opacity var(--d-o, 0.2s), -webkit-transform var(--d-t, 0.3s) var(--d-t-e, ease);
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify:checked {
         --b: var(--active);
         --bc: var(--active);
         --d-o: .3s;
         --d-t: .6s;
         --d-t-e: cubic-bezier(.2, .85, .32, 1.2);
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify:hover:not(:checked):not(:disabled) {
         --bc: var(--border-hover);
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify:focus {
         box-shadow: 0 0 0 var(--focus);
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify + label {
         //font-size: 14px;
         line-height: 1.5em;//21px;
         display: inline-block;
         vertical-align: top;
         cursor: pointer;
         margin-left: 4px;
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify.switch {
         width: 2.8em; //38px;
         border-radius: 11px;
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify.switch:after {
         left: 2px;
         top: 2px;
         border-radius: 50%;
         width: 1em;//15px;
         height: 1em;//15px;
         background: var(--ab, var(--border));
         -webkit-transform: translateX(var(--x, 0));
         transform: translateX(var(--x, 0));
      }
      input[type='checkbox'].switchify.switch:checked {
         --ab: var(--active-inner);
         --x: 17px;
      }
   /*}*/

   .table-button{
      text-align:center;
      vertical-align:middle;
      color:inherit;
      border:none;
      margin: auto auto;
      font-size:130%;
   }
   .adminUI .table-button.delete{ margin-top:-0.2em; }
   .table-button.delete:hover {
      color:skyblue;
   }
        
</style>

<script times="0">
   (function (){
      let i=0;
      {  //dbg
         let t=document.currentScript.getAttribute("times");
         t = typeof t == "string" ? parseInt(t) : t;
         console.log("processing #"+(++i)+"|"+(t+1),document.currentScript);
         document.currentScript.setAttribute("times",t+1);
         
      }

      // let script = document.currentScript; //script.parent = head???
      // //get label target
      //    //if class is not found an exception will be thrown as it will try to access null.nextElementSibling
      // let target = ( function findClass(className, start){
      //       console.log("parsing", start)
      //       return (start.classList.contains(className) ? start : findClass(start.nextElementSibling))
      //    }
      // )("blinktimes-label", script);

      let labelClass = "blinktimes-label";
      let appliedPlaceholderClass = "applied-"+labelClass;
      for( let target of document.getElementsByClassName(labelClass)){
         let parent = target.parentElement;
         if(!parent.getAttribute(appliedPlaceholderClass)){
            parent.setAttribute(appliedPlaceholderClass, Date.now())
            //modify container
            let computed = window.getComputedStyle(parent);
            //doesn't work: top is 0 at exec time (probably set by other scripts)
            //parent.style.top = `calc(${computed.top} + 20px)`;
            //console.log("parent style set to",parent.style.top," from ",computed.top,"el ",parent)
            parent.style.overflow = "visible";
         }
      }

      //console.log("script", script, target)
   })()
</script>
<style>
   .blinktimes-label {
      position:relative;
      top:20px;
      padding-left:5px;
   }
   .blinktimes-periodslider > p {
      padding-left:7px;
   }
</style>

name: initState label style&script
format:
<script times="0">
   (function (){
      let i=0;
      {  //dbg
         let t=document.currentScript.getAttribute("times");
         t = typeof t == "string" ? parseInt(t) : t;
         console.log("processing #"+(++i)+"|"+(t+1),document.currentScript);
         document.currentScript.setAttribute("times",t+1);
         
      }

      // let script = document.currentScript; //script.parent = head???
      // //get label target
      //    //if class is not found an exception will be thrown as it will try to access null.nextElementSibling
      // let target = ( function findClass(className, start){
      //       console.log("parsing", start)
      //       return (start.classList.contains(className) ? start : findClass(start.nextElementSibling))
      //    }
      // )("blinktimes-label", script);

      let labelClass = "blinktimes-label";
      let appliedPlaceholderClass = "applied-"+labelClass;
      for( let target of document.getElementsByClassName(labelClass)){
         let parent = target.parentElement;
         if(!parent.getAttribute(appliedPlaceholderClass)){
            parent.setAttribute(appliedPlaceholderClass, Date.now())
            //modify container
            let computed = window.getComputedStyle(parent);
            //doesn't work: top is 0 at exec time (probably set by other scripts)
            //parent.style.top = `calc(${computed.top} + 20px)`;
            //console.log("parent style set to",parent.style.top," from ",computed.top,"el ",parent)
            parent.style.overflow = "visible";
         }
      }
      
      //console.log("script", script, target)
   })()
</script>
<style>
   .initstate-label {
      position:relative;
      top:20px;
      padding-left:5px;
   }
</style>

name: hold and pair
hold and pair
about mutual-updating widjets
info:
the two widjets represent two way to edit the same value.
As such each of them updates its counterpart with the new value.


dataflow:
let LW,RW be the leftmost and rightmost widject
LW stops data, RW repeats it

case 1
    LW EDITED -> LW Sends payload -> RW Updated 
        -> RW passthrough msg (same value) -> LINKOUT & LOOPBACK to LW
            -> LW receives a msg that leaves LW unchanged -> END
case 2
    RW EDITED -> LINKOUT & LOOPBACK to LW -> LW Updated -> END

name: triel
format:
<style>
    select {
        /* styling */
        background-color: white;
        border: thin solid blue;
        border-radius: 4px;
        display: inline-block;
        font: inherit;
        line-height: 1.5em;
        padding: 0.5em 3.5em 0.5em 1em;

        /* reset */

        margin: 0;      
        -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
        -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
        box-sizing: border-box;
        -webkit-appearance: none;
        -moz-appearance: none;
    }

    select.minimal {
        background-image:
            linear-gradient(45deg, transparent 50%, gray 50%),
            linear-gradient(135deg, gray 50%, transparent 50%),
            linear-gradient(to right, #ccc, #ccc);
        background-position:
            calc(100% - 20px) calc(1em + 2px),
            calc(100% - 15px) calc(1em + 2px),
            calc(100% - 2.5em) 0.5em;
        background-size:
            5px 5px,
            5px 5px,
            1px 1.5em;
        background-repeat: no-repeat;
    }

    select.minimal:focus {
        background-image:
            linear-gradient(45deg, green 50%, transparent 50%),
            linear-gradient(135deg, transparent 50%, green 50%),
            linear-gradient(to right, #ccc, #ccc);
        background-position:
            calc(100% - 15px) 1em,
            calc(100% - 20px) 1em,
            calc(100% - 2.5em) 0.5em;
        background-size:
            5px 5px,
            5px 5px,
            1px 1.5em;
        background-repeat: no-repeat;
        border-color: green;
        outline: 0;
    }


    select:-moz-focusring {
        color: transparent;
        text-shadow: 0 0 0 #000;
    }
</style>

<select class="minimal">
  <option>CSS SELECT arrow (minimal)</option>
  <option>No external background image</option>
  <option>No wrapper</option>
</select>

name: format
inflate
about fallbackGUIVars
info:
fallbackGUIVars holds both the failsafe JSON and some
    handling functions that are always injected into new GUIVars instances
the functions are restored by <root>.inflate( ), as they cannot be stored in 
    a json file.

read global.utils.genericInflater() for more info

unpackTo flow

if(!msg.unpackTo(flow))
    node.error(new Error("something went wrong while unpacking shared flow variables"));

name: unpackTo flow

toggle smt
Logo / Clock
format:
<script id="clockScript1" type="text/javascript">
    var clockInterval;
    $(function () {
        if (clockInterval) return;

        


        var logoContainer = document.createElement("div");
        logoContainer.style.margin = "5px auto";
        //logoContainer.style.marginBottom = "0px";
        
        var imgCont = document.createElement("span");
        logoContainer.append(imgCont);
        imgCont.style.position = "relative";
        imgCont.style.top = "5px";

        var imgCont2 = document.createElement("span");
        imgCont2.style.marginLeft="30px";
        logoContainer.append(imgCont2);

        logoGiga = new Image();
        logoGiga.src = "/loghi/giga/logoGiga.png";
        logoGiga.height = 30;
        logoContainer.children[1].append(logoGiga);

        
        logoItal = new Image();
        logoItal.src = "/loghi/italmatic/logoItalmatic.png";
        logoItal.height = 30;
        logoContainer.children[0].append(logoItal);

        //add clock
        var div2 = $('<div/>');
        var p = $('<p/>');

        div2.append(p);
        div2[0].style.margin = '5px';

        function displayTime() {
            p.text(new Date().toLocaleString());
        }
        
        clockInterval = setInterval(displayTime, 1000);

        //add to toolbar when it's available
        var addToToolbarTimer;
        
        function addToToolbar() {
            var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
            
            if(!toolbar.length) return;
            
            toolbar.append(logoContainer);
            toolbar.append(div2);
            clearInterval(addToToolbarTimer);
        }
        addToToolbarTimer = setInterval(addToToolbar, 100);
    });
</script>

command: shutdown /r /d p:4:1 /c "riavvio giornaliero pianificato da e per server nodered" /T 0

name: parameters info
info:
https://learn.microsoft.com/it-it/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/shutdown

/r -> restart
/d -> document shutdown reason -> planned, for app maintenance
/c -> document shutdown reason -> "..."

name: catch restoreState fileNotFound -> skip
catch restoreState all -> error
restore state
